a.title: Flu Shot Clinic Open to the Community

li.a: Flu Shot Clinic Open to the Community

div.span: High Levels of learning for all Students

a.title: quickLink
a.span: Visit our athletics department for the latest news and pictures from our teams. You can also get information about attending games with schedules, ticket information, and maps to our facilities.

a.title: quickLink
a.span:
Parents and schools need to work together for the betterment of the students. Parents play an important role in providing support and building the confidence of their
children.

span.a: Welcome to e-Funds for Schools.This service eliminates the cash you give your children and checks you write the school. You are able to pay for all of your student's meals, ASB activities and athletics.

a.title: quickLink
a.span: Interested in attending one of our schools? Click here for enrollment information including school boundaries. You can also learn more about our schools, programs, and campuses.

div.script:
$(document).ready(function () {
        var logConsole = function (str) {
            console.log(str);
        };
        if ($('#tabPortlet_354601 .divTabEdit').val() == "True") {
            var isModern = ('True');
            if(isModern.toLowerCase() == "true")
            {
                var tabObj = $('#tabPortlet_354601 ');
                var tabM = $('#ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl41_divTabs').attr('portlet') == 'tab';

                function activate() {
                    $(tabObj).scrollingTabs({                 
                        tabs: [{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl41_divTabs_0","title":"Covid-19 FAQ","content":"Coupeville Family FAQ - April 21, 2020
\n
\nCoupeville Family FAQ Spanish - April 21, 2020","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl41_divTabs_1","title":"Internet Safety and Availability","content":"
Internet Safety:
\n
\nEach student must sign a notice of their intent to abide by district rules for use of the district’s network. The district has established firewalls to block access to inappropriate sites. Families are encouraged to discuss Internet safety in general, including maintaining confidentiality of login/password information. Here are several links that may be useful:\n\n    
OnGuardOnline.gov\n    
YouTube\n    
OSPI School Safety Center\n\n
Internet Safety and Cyberbullying Advice: Videos
\nHere are a few links for you to explore:\n\n    
Heads Up: Stop. Think. Click.\n    
Share with Care\n    
Stand Up to Cyberbulling\n\nInternet Availability:
\n
\n
\nHaving a reliable internet connection is preferred when using Google Classroom.  However, Google allows you to download documents from a Google Classroom with an internet connection and use them offline. Families may use our parking lots closest to the buildings to access our FREE public WiFi to establish an internet connection.  Using an electronic device or Chromebook, the student can log into their Google Classrooms, download their assignments, and then work at home without an internet connection.  Later, the device needs to establish an internet connection (doesn't have to be the same as before) and upload the documents back to the Google Classroom.\n\n    
Google Offline Help Link\n\n\n
Internet From A Cell Phone:
\n
\nDid you know you can get the internet from your cell phone? Yes, it's called tethering or it's also referred to as a personal hotspot.  Your phone uses your data and sends out a WiFi signal for electronic devices to log onto. Most carriers are offering personal hotspot use for their customers at no additional cost.  Please visit with your cell phone carrier prior to using a personal hotspot.\n\n    
Hotspot Information Link\n    
How to turn your phone into a Hotspot\n    \n    
iPhone\n    \n    
Android
\n    
\n    \n    \n    ","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl41_divTabs_2","title":"Google Classroom For Parents","content":"
Google Classroom For Parents
\n\n
Google Classroom is a web-based learning environment. When logged into Google Classroom, students can collaborate with their peers and teachers. Google Classroom offers a digital safe space for students to view class announcements, access posted course content, view posted assignments, and turn in completed work. Only authorized Coupeville users (students, teachers, and other designated staff members) can have access to an Coupeville Google Classroom. Google users outside the Coupeville network are not granted permission to any Coupeville Classroom.\n
Parents can access their child’s teachers’ Google Classroom in one of the following ways:
\n
\n1. From the school issued Chromebook, ask the student to login and launch the Google Classroom App.  Please note that any activity in Google Classroom is documented under the student’s login and it would be inappropriate for a parent to communicate with the teacher or other students in Google Classroom. Parents should use their personal email to digitally communicate with the teacher.
\n
\n2. From any computer with internet access, click this link https://classroom.google.com and have the student login with their Coupeville username and password. Please note that any activity in Google Classroom is documented under the student’s login and it would be inappropriate for a parent to communicate with the teacher or other students in Google Classroom. Parents should use their personal email to digitally communicate with the teacher.
\n
\n3. As a guardian, you can receive email summaries showing your student’s progress in classroom.\n\n    
You can choose the frequency of the emails, such as daily or weekly.\n    
You can unsubscribe or remove yourself from Classroom at any time.\n\n
Guardian email summaries include:\n\n    
Missing work—Work that’s late at the time the email was sent\n    
Upcoming work—Work that’s due today and tomorrow (for daily emails) or work that’s due in the upcoming week (for weekly emails)\n    
Class activity—Announcements, assignments, and questions recently posted by teachers\n\n
See more details here https://support.google.com/edu/classroom/answer/6388136\n
Parents Guide to Google Classroom","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl41_divTabs_3","title":"Device Checkout Hotline ","content":"If your student needs a device for remote learning, please contact the Device Hotline 360-678-2587.
\n
","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl41_divTabs_4","title":"Chromebook General Information","content":"\n
How to Connect your Chromebook to Wi-Fi \n\nConectar de un Chromebook a Wi-Fi 
\n
\nCannot Connect Chromebook To A Network\n
If your Chromebook is currently unable to connect to the internet, please check for the following: \n\n    
Make sure the network you’re connected to is properly set up and able to access the Internet. \n    
Try connecting your device to a different network.\n    
Contact our support team at 360-678-2587\n\n
Technical Support \n
If you experience issues with your Chromebook not responding, try powering the Chromebook off and turning on. We are able to offer limited remote support for issues with your Chromebook and can not guarantee the availability of support throughout the break. If you are experiencing issues that are not resolved by these steps, please contact your students teacher or 360-678-2587. ","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl41_divTabs_5","title":"iPad General Information","content":"
How to Connect your iPad to Wi-Fi\n\n
Conectar un iPad a Wi-Fi\n\n
\n\n\n
\nCannot Connect iPad To A Network\n
If your iPad is currently unable to connect to the internet, please check for the following: \n\n    
Make sure the network you’re connected to is properly set up and able to access the Internet. \n    
Try connecting your device to a different network.\n    
Contact our support team at 360-678-2587\n\n
Technical Support \n
If you experience issues with your iPad not responding, try powering the iPad off and turning on. We are able to offer limited remote support for issues with your iPad and can not guarantee the availability of support throughout the break. If you are experiencing issues that are not resolved by these steps, please contact your students teacher or 360-678-2587. ","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl41_divTabs_6","title":"Student Support Services","content":"Student Support Services Link","active":false,"disabled":false}],// required,
                        propPaneId: 'paneId', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propTitle: 'title', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propActive: 'active', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propDisabled: 'disabled', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propContent: 'content', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        tabMode : tabM,
                        scrollToTabEdge: false, // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        disableScrollArrowsOnFullyScrolled: false // optional- pass in default value for demo purposes
                    }).on('ready.scrtabs', function() {
                        $('#'+this.id+' .tab-pane').attr('tabindex',0);
                    });
                };

                activate();
            }
        }
    });

span.style: letter-spacing: 0.3px; text-align: center; font-family: Tahoma; font-size: 32px; color: rgb(192, 0, 0);

span.br: Connected Food Program during School Closure

br.style: color: rgb(28, 30, 33); font-family: Tahoma; font-size: x-large; letter-spacing: 0.3px; text-align: center;
color: rgb(28, 30, 33); font-family: Tahoma; font-size: x-large; letter-spacing: 0.3px; text-align: center;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; font-size: 24px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: On Monday March 23 we are going to start delivering lunches to all children 18 and younger to all bus stops in our school district. Because of federal regulation the free lunch can only be provided to a child if they are present when we deliver. If you want lunch for someone who is not at the bus stop it will cost $5.00. We will continue to offer curbside lunch in the high school parking lot Monday through Friday 10:00 am - 11:30 am.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

br.span: To get the lunch delivery schedule click

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

br.style: color: rgb(28, 30, 33); font-family: Tahoma; font-size: x-large; letter-spacing: 0.3px; text-align: center;
color: rgb(28, 30, 33); font-family: Tahoma; font-size: x-large; letter-spacing: 0.3px; text-align: center;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; font-size: 24px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: El lunes 23 de marzo vamos a comenzar a entregar almuerzos a todos los nios de 18 y menoresen todas las paradas de autobs en nuestro distrito escolar. Debido a la regulacin federal, el almuerzo gratis solo se puede proporcionar a un nio si est presente cuando entregamos. Si quiere almorzar para alguien que no est en la parada del autobs, le costar $ 5.00. Continuaremos ofreciendo almuerzos en la acera en el estacionamiento de la escuela secundaria de lunes a viernes de 10:00 a.m. a 11:30 a.m.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

br.span: Para obtener el horario de entrega del almuerzo, haga clic

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Due to the current campus closures nationwide, and the social distancing mandates, The College Board has cancelled SATs until June. For our campus, the April 14 school day test is also cancelled. The next SAT session will be Saturday, June 6. Coupeville HS campus will open up as a testing center for this day. We will notify CHS students when the session opens up for registration on the SAT website.

span.style: font-size: 20px; text-decoration: underline; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(192, 0, 0);

strong.style: font-size: 20px; font-family: Tahoma; text-align: center; color: rgb(192, 0, 0);

div.span: Read More About Information about Measles

span.strong: Equal Employment Opportunities ~ Equal Educational Opportunities

h6.span: Coupeville School District does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The board designates the superintendent to serve as the district's coordinator regarding: Title IX; Section 504/ADA; Civil Rights Compliance; and to handle questions and investigate any complaints communicated to the district of alleged discrimination. Superintendent, 501 S. Main Street, Coupeville, WA 98239, 360.678.2404
